data.title: Fantastic Downtown Find!
data.text: Fantastic food that is good for sharing! Over 40 beers on tap and prices were really reasonable. Everything that we tried was delicious! Highly recommend and I would go there again!

data.title: Great Service, Great Food, Excellent Value
data.text:
I was surprised to read the previous review. Our experience was great - service, food, and value. I agree not exactly like the tapas you get in Barcelona but it is the concept and these folks get it right. Small portions of extremely well prepared and flavourful dishes. They have a great bar, very extensive beer listing. 
Our server was helpful and we had a very pleasant evening on a busy night.

data.title: POOR Selections, NOT TRUE TAPAS! Horrible Expensive Experience!!
data.text: Me and a friend went here Saturday night after much anticipation. I have eaten tapas all over the world and this restaurant by far has the worst selection ever. I don't think it is a TRUE tapas place and it is quite disappointment because it is Tulsa's first tapas restaurant. I don't see it staying open long unless they offer real tapas.there were lots of waiters and waitresses standing around not very attentive. The drinks are expensive and they serve them in a very tiny glass. will probably not go here again unless they bring true tapas

owner_response.author: , Owner at Torero Bar and Kitchen, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm so sorry you didn't have a positive experience at Torero.  It seems my staff failed in explaining the concept to you.  As we are not a traditional tapas bar and a restaurant inspired by Central, South American, and a Spanish way of dinning I apologize for any misunderstanding.  I would love to invite you back to try us again and let me buy you some food. 

If you have any questions or comments for me please let me know.
Here is my cell: (918) 671-5537
noah@torerobarandkitchen.com

Noah Bush
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Visiting the BOK
data.text: My wife and I stopped here for a bite to eat before a concert at the BOK. We were visiting from out of state, and just walking the area. The restaurant is very neat, hip, and stylish.  The menu was odd, and not easy to decipher.  We eventually settled on beef tacos and mushrooms (disguised in the menu).  The tacos were good, but the mushrooms were strangely prepared.  We determined they were trying too hard to be different, and the food suffered.  The prices were acceptable.

data.title: Coffee Shop located in the Hyatt Regency
data.text: I ordered an ice coffee and it was enjoyable as was the Chai Tea I ordered by a friend.  Service was prompt and courteous.

data.title: Great vibe- awesome tapas!
data.text:
In from AZ for a work meeting- was recommended to us -and this place was awesome! Great environment- very cool modern with a touch of rustic feel to it; wrought iron steps; metal and wood tables, and stools and an amazing bar. Per location near the BOK Center.

Food was even better- holy cow the salmon tapas- get it!!! Wish I could remember everything we ate but I can't- Paul our waiter recommended everything and he nailed it! Everything was so good, and he was one of the best waiters I have had in along time! Wish this place was in Phoenix!

data.title: Totally Surprised
data.text: We went on a concert night and knew it would be busy.  The waiter did everything to accommodate us.  We had three different dishes and it was all very good.  The tacos were excellent.  Can't wait to go back and taste the fish tacos.  I am not sure of the cost, the boss bought, but we will try again on our dime.

data.title: OLE, Torero, OLE
data.text: I can't tell you how happy I am that this wonderfully chic, upscale (but not too upscale), incredible restaurant opened in my building.  We had dinner there shortly after it opened before a concert.  Service was top notch which is not typical of a new restaurant.  We had the proveleta (a melted cheese appetizer - a must have) the empanadas and a fish dish that was amazing.  Excellent, fresh mixed drinks and a lively atmosphere!  It was so good, that immediately after the concert, we went back for more....and you will too!!

data.title: Best Cuban Sandwich in town
data.text:
I stopped in for lunch.  I had an overly-sweet draft Wheat beer and their take on a Cuban Sandwich they call a Medianoche Cubana.  Thirteen bucks for a sandwich with no side dish is a bit pricy - could have used a cup of soup or a few papas frites. The place is NOISY.  All hard surfaces in a large room makes for a lot of echoes.  So don't plan on having a conversation about what to order. 
BUT, the sandwich is the best cuban sandwich in Tulsa.
Amber was a fine waitress. 
I need to go back to try the goat.

data.title: Great drinks....terrible food!
data.text: Great cocktail/wine/beer menu.  Food was barely edible, with exception of ceviche, which was $15.00 for about half a cup of fish-not a good value.  Meat was fatty and  I was unable to cut the chicken with a knife.  Roasted vegetables were so charred they were mostly inedible.  Potatoes were smothered with way too much chimchurri sauce. A melted cheese dish was greasy but flavorable. Ordered the fish tacos as a saving grace and they did not deliver.  All in all, we left with a $140.00 tab and went to another restaurant to eat.  Wait staff was very kind, I felt sorry for them.

owner_response.author: , Owner at Torero Bar and Kitchen, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
I'm sorry your experience at Torero was not a positive one.  As we've recently opened we had some kinks to work out as well as unpredictable business swings. Service and a quality product is all we strive for. I hope that you'll consider coming back in and giving us another try as we've recently reworked some menu items.  The restaurant business is not an exact science but we strive to make the customers happy. 

If you have any questions or comments please contact me. Below is my personal cell and email address.
918 671 5537
noah@torerobarandkitchen.com
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Bonito, agradável
data.text:
Espaço bem conseguido, no centro da cidade, em zona marcadamente de serviços, comercio e de laser.
A decoração é simples mas agradável, com bons apontamentos. De linhas modernas e com toques de requinte.
Ementa contida e limitada mas com alguns pratos bem elaborados. Rações pequenas, mesmo para europeus.
Aberto até um pouco mais tarde. Entrámos para jantar às 20h e foi o único restaurante da zona que nos serviu.
Preço um pouco acima da média.
